I tend to agree with past reviews about the crowd in Zeki's, but it's not the bars fault, just drink more and you won't notice, or you'll become one of the crowd! 

The room tends to spin at the end of the night, or is it just me???
author: Craig E.

description:
You know what? I'm feeling generous. Was gonna give this place 4 stars, but fuck it turn down the lights and have another piece of pie.

Here's why I like Zeki's: it's a small, unassuming joint in a quiet part of town, it's got this real cozy feel to it with the (real) fireplace going, there's two nicely sized TV's to get your sports on, the decor is cool and is very pub-like, great beer selection, and oooweeee that bartender's hot. If that's not five stars, then frankly my friend you can fuck right off.
author: Drew S.

description: Great dive bar.  Fireplace, warm (sometimes a little too warm), cozy and usually a nice, friendly crowd.  Drinks are cheap!
author: Wendy L.

description:
So many good memories here. Zeki or his brother are almost always there. Pool table, fireplace, mixed crowd. Perfect place to reserve for parties.

Update: under new ownership.
author: Gretchen T.

description:
This place is great. Pool. Bartendresses from heaven. Near a lot of my friends houses. Great place to start or end the night.

I refuse to give it the 4th star because of the ridiculous prices during happy hours. It loses the 5th because of the crowd.
author: Tyler W.

description:
Met up here with friends. 

Friendly causal, neiborhood bar with good drinks! Liked the ambiance...will go again. Only down side is that it is not in walking distance to other places....must take a cab to go elsewhere.
author: Kristina A.

description:
I have been here quite a few times. Their drinks are ok, nothing special. Its a kewl hang out place. People if you know them are friendly, else its a different issue.  The locals to this place dont come out till 10 PM.  

I would recommend checking it out.
author: Amlan S.

description:
It's half a block away from my apartment.  Awesome.




'Nuff said.
author: Dianne d.

description:
I throw this bar in the same bucket as U-Lee Restaurant on Hyde Street - somewhere you're comfortable, won't blow a wad of cash, and doesn't necessitate a pair of high heels/collared shirt. 

That said, they've got a lovely fireplace, and if you like seeing sophomoric scrawlings of phrases such as "Tara's a hooker!" and "John likes boobs!" in public places (they've got chalkboards above the pool table), drag yourself up the vertical stretch of California Street to Zeki's.
author: Carla C.

description:
Zeki's is a great little bar. It's small, but always filled with young, fun people. Actually, it's always filled with guys, so if you are a single woman, you should definitely go here! They play great bar music (ranging from Jay Z to Color Me Badd to Bon Jovi), and they have a pool table.

The decorations are random and slightly cheesey, but who cares? It actually adds to the charm. They have a pretty big selection of beer, and the service is great.

Rock on Zeki's!
author: Jamie C.

description: This is a regular favorite neighborhood stop for my boyfriend and I, so I figured it would be the perfect place to host a surprise birthday party for him last Sunday, and we were not disappointed.  The staff was amazing and the drinks, as always, were always great.  It was a bit of a challenge to get some of our friends to actually come to Nob Hill, but everyone loved Zekis so much that now I'm afraid our secret spot will no longer be much of a secret!  Great place to grab a drink or in our case, to spend an entire Sunday..
author: Renee A.

description:
Zeki
I love this bar. I would always pass by it on the bus and think "I want to try that bar out." Tonight I finally did; great neighborhood bar with a great crowd. The ball game was on last night and it was not so load that I could not hear my friend Sara talk. They have a pool table and the bathrooms were clean. I was hesitating to write about this place because I would like it to stay fairly mellow but I had to write something; great atmosphere and service. I will go again many times.
author: E P.

description:
One of my favorite dive bars.  You can't go wrong with the great atmosphere in there.  Now I've only been after work during the middle of the week, but its a perfect place to unwind.  

The bartenders are always nice, and they have great beers on tap, so i'm not complaining at all.  I usually just go with friends and sit at the bar and talk.  Its really one of the last bars where you can actually do that with out yelling across 37 people.

Its also really nice when its cold outside.  The two fireplaces keep things warm on the outside, while the alcohol keeps things warm on the inside.  I totally recommend this place,check it out.
author: Aaron G.

description:
So I am basically complaining that the 10 dollar crack ho isn't a 1000 dollar dominitrix. My bad.

Points off because the bartender is really just a lager puller. Some people are into just getting a quick lager pull. I like something a little more involved and exotic when out, say a mixed drink or even a cocktail. I should just go to the Tonga Room or even better Alembic for full service happiness from experienced mixologists. 

Great pub atmosphere- low ceilings, roaring fire, vaguely threatening regulars. 

Solid neighborhood joint though.
author: Krismet C.

description:
Zeki's is a pale shadow of what it once was. Ever since the ownership change and the the total makeover, it became just another faceless, boring wannabe trendy bar, catering to the newcomer transient crowd. I went there recently to see how it is now, and the only things I can remember are:
- top 40 hip-hop blasting from the speakers;
- ridiculous crowd at the bar, making it next to impossible to squeeze your order in;
- a barback asking my part to vacate the seats at the back as a crowd of 30 arrived to the apparently reserved seats (there was no sign or anything). 
- an older guy, a regular from the old days, who still loyally comes to Zeki's, even though nothing from the old bar remains here. He tried to enjoy his beer, but was eventually squeezed out by the young crowd. He was not talking to anyone at or behind the bar, as he once used to. That just made me sad.

In a nutshell, the location will still keep this place popular. But me, I'll go looking for classier places. 




My review from 2007:
Zeki's is the first bar I ever visited in San Francisco (YEARs ago), and that is why it occupies a special place in my heart... I mean, my liver.

It used to be lively and popular with the European crowd, had cute innocent-looking bartenders, and had an old-school jukebox - one of my favourite in town. I used to come in here at least a couple of times a month, even though I never lived in Nob Hill and parking is a bitch around here. I felt welcome and almost at home here. I knew the regulars. I always loved the fireplace. I met lots of interesting people here and even made some friends. Zeki's is one of the coziest bars in San Francisco and is specially welcoming on a rainy cold night. 

Now, I come only occasionally. Why? Perhaps because I discovered lots of other great bars in San Francisco, or maybe it's because Zeki's changes a little too much for a neighbourhood pub. Just as you get used to a bartender, there's a new one (I can't remember how many this place has gone through). Regulars move out of the 'hood, and the crowd is becoming more occasional, one-time visitor-like. And jukebox, the type where you could browse CD's by pressing "left" and "right" buttons, has been replaced with one of those new electronic ones. With that, the bar has lost its soul... or its liver? 

Still, it's a great little bar, tucked away on a steep hill on the cable car line. At home I may never feel here, but I sure hope I am still welcome as a guest.
author: Evg R.

description:
One of the best neighborhood bars in SF. The owner, Maho, is a very friendly fellow who is usually around shooting pool, tending bar, or playing dominoes with some of the regulars. His brother, Zeki, used to own this eponymous watering hole.

Maho works hard to maintain a friendly, unpretentious place. Zeki's is a guaranteed good time, whether you go with a group of friends or just swing by solo for a beer. All the patrons are friendly and accessible, and it's easy to strike up a conversation with just about anyone. 

There's a juke box, a small pool table, and a fireplace. The bartenders are usually pretty easy on the eyes, and they're attentive and efficient. The scene changes from day to day, depending on how busy it gets, but early in the week it's almost always a laid back atmosphere.
author: Peter B.

description:
Probably one of my favorite bars to go to in SF!

I have been going here for a long time, my buddy has lived right across the street for years.
Its the quintessential neighborhood bar.  All of the bartenders are good looking(ladies), and their drinks are on the cheaper side.  What more can you ask for? (Thank You Maho- Owner)
The pool table is a little uneven, but it doesn't matter cause I'm usually too drunk to shoot straight anyway!

Love this place!  Check it out!
author: Matt P.

description: This is one of those staple bars where it's not the most exciting place in the area, but you can bet you'll have a good time hanging out with friends, shooting some pool, and just relaxing on any given night. You can bring food in, even cards or games if you like, and the bartenders are a bunch of cute eastern European women so there's something for everybody. The crowd is in their 20s and with neighboring bars like Hyde Out, Nob Hill Tavern and California Dreamin', it's really the only Nob Hill bar that has a young scene.
author: Anthony C.

description: Nice.  everyone I've met here so far has been really laid back and cool.  Come when it's cold and foggy out and they light a nice warm fire.  Perfect place to sit back and relax for an hour or two before heading home.
author: Mason G.

description:
Two stars for the interior which resembles the cabin of an old wooden ship. You expect Captain Jack to emerge with a bottle of rum and a bad attitude.

Instead you're surrounded by a crowd of post-adolescent self conscious kids.

Shame really. This place used to be a gay bar catering to middle aged men. i lived a few houses down and would come here to watch a ball game. Merle Haggard would be playing in the backround. I was the only straight guy in there and they were totally cool with that.  Then ownership changed and it went faux Marina.

Captain Jack would never be seen here unless he was looting the place grabbing booty.
author: K I L O W A T T.

description: My husband watched the Giants game here and loved the small neighborhood feel. Happy hour started early on Saturday too!
author: Caitlin B.

description: Not the same neighborhood bar anymore after the redesign. Drinks are overpriced, costs about twice as much now. Pool table gone and so are the round tables and chairs. Now the place looks more upscale and expensive. Lost one more nice neighborhood bar. Hyde out, here I come :)
author: luvmunky B.

description: I love this bar. Zekis is a perfect place to watch sports or just grab a few bevs and hang out. Whether you're in the mood to watch whatever big game is on or you just want to hang out and drink by the fireplace, this is your spot... it's the best of both worlds.
author: Jennette E.

description: Soooo, not only is Zeki's the best - but my husband and i just name our dog Zeki after this AWESOME joint.  (well, I should mention my hubs and I met there- pre-remodel.  but we love it post-remodel too!)
author: Brigid R.

description: What a cozy little nook of a neighborhood irish bar.  Fireplace, pool table, great Nob Hill location; all these ingredients spell character.  Love this little place.
author: Rick H.

description: *note* Zeki's has a fantastic projection HD TV yet it isn't open for football games on Sundays? WTF?!? I can't knock them down a star for not being open when I want them to be but I'm disappointed that they aren't open for NFL games on a Sunday.
author: phil h.

description: I know I can go there any night of the week and find a descent crowd. My favorite thing to do there is play backwards connect 4. That's when you try to get the other person to connect 4 without knowing it. Wayyy more interesting. Oh and the bartenders are cool too.
author: Linda S.

description: Cool little pub. Much better than the other surrounding bars. Wish they had food here. They have a pool table and 4 TVs. It's not fancy, but not a dive either.
author: Shane T.

description:
Finally, a bar with a good Belgian beer on tap. I felt right at home here; Chimay on a tap handle, old stained wood charm, people in t-shirts and jeans and a pool table off to the side. Alas, I did not order the Chimay because it was $8, which - I know - is appropriate for a bar, but I had been to the Hyde Out and Amelie earlier and couldn't bring myself to throw more than $5.50 down for a Sam Adams. The bartenders were fine, nothing special. 

Looks like they are doing $2 buds on Giant's game nights. Good stuff.
author: Matt S.

description: This place is just nice enough not to be divey but still has that local dive bar appeal. The fire place, pool table and internet juke box are great, but the real reason to stop by on Thursdays is this hottie bar tender named Matt. He's tall, tan, kinda scruffy, pretty green-eyed outdoorsy type. I think he said he's from the midwest - so that's a plus! Ladies, do yourself a favor and stop by on Thursday nights...
author: Kathy L.

description: Really rad bar and staff. Eric, is probably their best on staff. He once saw his cake.getting stolen by a customer and instead of getting upset, he offered the person a cake of her own. Only here.
author: Alec P.

description: I've been dropping by Zeki's about once a year for the past 7 years, and my observation has been that it's not the same twice.  it can be mobbed, or delightfully empty with the exception of some highly literary Yelpers.  Never underestimate the power of a fireplace on a foggy Nob Hill summer night.
author: Beth V.

description: Very convienant location for me while visiting the best friend in San Francisco. She lives in the neighborhood. This was one of the first bars we visited when she moved to the city. And we go back everytime I'm in town.
author: Lynda O.

description: I like Zeki's.  I don't love it, but I like it.  Lots of beer to choose from, good drinks, reasonably priced.  It's also generally pretty bustling and has a happy vibe to it.  One problem is that it is pretty small and if you sit at one of the few tables, chances are you are close to the bathroom and you have to keep your nose in your drink to stifle the terrible smell.  But, keep to the front half of the bar or near the fireplace (yeah, a fireplace, pretty cool) then you should have a nice ol' time at Zeki's!
author: Lauren H.

description: Great neighborhood bar. Good beer selection, decent prices (a little high) but very friendly service. It's a good spot to watch a game, although you might need to help them find it if it's not a Cal or 49ers game.
author: Chris B.

description: There's a pool table in this bar with a sub-par beer selection and somewhat friendly bar tenders.  I might try going here one more time but there are simply so many better, more exciting bars in Zeki's vicinity.
author: Scott G.

description: Some friends and I recently hosted a birthday party at Zeki's and had an awesome time! It is such a great spot! The bartenders were awesome, cocktails were amazing (definitely try the strawberry capiroska) and overall vibe was perfect. I highly recommend Zeki's whether just going in for a few cocktails or hosting an event.
author: Michelle M.

description: This place didn't leave much of an impression on me. When the bartender's friend skipped over Keep on Lovin' You by REO in favor of Ryan Adams on the digital juke I got a sour taste in my mouth that never went away. $4.50 for a Corona? Better choices out there.
author: Colin S.

description: I love Zeki's. It's my neighborhood joint.  End the night here every Fri/Sat and usually come in once a week for a drink. Cheers to Maho!! Good beer selection, but the wine selection is not so great.
author: Jenny W.

description: The hottest bar staff in San Francisco!
author: Zack O.

description: I would say this is more midnob hill.  Walk up hill you are in Nob Hill, walk down hill and you are in the Tenderloin keep that in mind.  They get a star for totally decking the place out for Halloween (way to go with the spirit).  One star for the fact that people there seem pretty chill even in such a small space. The third star for not being super expensive and unfortunately they lost a star because they were out of my first two choices of beer on a Saturday night at 11:30 (too early to be out of beer).  I did have fun at this bar and of course as I usually say, it is in the people you have around you.  Good people make for good fun!!  Check it out if you want to go to a small bar with alot of spirit.
author: Kylie L.

description: Well, actually 3.5 stars for this place.  The drinks are great, ambience is fun and the music is usually pretty good, too.  I was there one night when a guy bought pizza for the whole bar - it pretty sweet.  But the drinks are expensive - $5.50 for a beer, are we at AT&T Park?  If you go here stick with the $6 cocktails, at least you get something for your money.
author: Jamie E.

description: Great neighborhood bar in Nob Hill. There is a good cast of regulars at this place, and the owner/employees are all very nice. Decent selection of draft beer on tap and wide array of spirits. They have a few flat screen tv's for sports and have one pool table in back. My complaint is that the pool table does not properly fit in the nook and your cue is always bumping the wall. Oh well. I will be back, great jumping off spot or place to come for a night cap.
author: John F.

description: I haven't been to Zeki's in years, but ended up there twice last week.  Once on a Thursday for the drink that put me over the edge, and once for a fundraiser on Saturday.  What I noticed both nights, is that this is the kind of bar guys actually want to go to in the same way girls want to go to a wine bar to catch up with their friends.  At all hours, there were hot guys just doing thier thing, ready to talk to everyone in the bar.  Not an aggressive dating scene, but an easy place to meet nice guys.  I'm giving it 3 stars because the drinks were not well mixed and the decor is very dated.  I guess that makes it a very successful dive bar though.
author: Jessica V.

description: Sadly enough, this used to be one of the best watering holes in town. Good jukebox, great sports locale, warm fireplace, pool table, a great neighborhood bar. Unfortunately, the remodel has turned it into another d-fest type establishment on the weekends and have taken away from its charm. I'll be the first to admit that I was smack in the middle of that scene when I was 20-something, but Zeki's sorely lost its charm when they remodeled. Sometimes change isn't good...
author: Jim P.

description: Love this place.  Bartenders are great.  Owner is very cool.  Easy place to make friends.  Fire place is helpful on a cold night.  Can always get a good game of 3-ball on the pool table in the back.  Close to the Fairmont so you always get to meet people from all over.
author: Shawn S.

description: Zeki's is a Nob Hill institution. It's a friendly, neighborhood bar with great beers on tap...and a fireplace! Great little (and I mean little) bar to chat it up with your friends or meet some random locals, especially during the weekdays. It can get a little crowded during the weekends, but then again, what place doesn't?
author: Natalie T.

description: went here after work for "a drink" with Althea D.  We wandered up the hill out of Union Square looking for somewhere new and open that we could yelp about later.   When we walked by Zeki's, I remembered that Beth L had mentioned it before and seemed to like it.  We looked through the window, and were impressed with the decor, so we stopped in.  Well "a drink" turned into more like... 4 drinks, plus a jager bomb each, and we were feeling real good by about 930.  The atmosphere is really low key here, very casual, but no one looks down on you for wanting to party like a rockstar with jager.  I'm pretty sure I also noticed some cute gay men here, although i wasn't really paying attention last night.  The only thing I didn't really like about this place was that they play 4 or 5 songs by the same band in a row, and then move on.  Come on guys, let's break it up a little bit, you know?
author: Caleb D.

description: It's cozy, the bartender is sexy, but nothing overly special.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Pretty chill nob hill bar.  They have relatively cheap drinks.  The crowd definitely has the neighborhood feel to it.   Been here a few times for midweek b-day drinks and have always had a great time.
author: Robert R.

description: I lived right around the corner from here for a year. It was great having carlsberg on tap so close, and a fireplace. but the crowd was ridiculously broish and weird. Who passed out ads for Zeki's in the marina?? I got to know the real locals though, and that made it worthwhile. plus it was 30 seconds from my bedroom, running. Neighbor's would always call the police when we talked too long outside.
author: matt c.

description: Oh how I miss this wonderful neighborhood bar!  My husband and I were regulars here for years and I love everything about it from the cozy fireplace, pooltables, friendly and talkative neighborhood drunk Richard, and of course Maho...everyone loves Maho!
author: Jacquelyn M.

description: I like this place because it's laid back and never a crowded cattle shoot. However, it doesn't get 5 or 4 stars because the bartenders sucked last time and there were a few weirdos in their pajamas. I realize it's a local bar and it was March Madness time but put on some real clothes man. Plus the pool table is soo packed in the back that you can never really shoot without the shorty. It sucks. But it's still on my list of places I'd go.
author: Cassy R.

description: Any place with a pool table and a fireplace is all right with me.  Great easy bar as long as it's not too crowded.  Great place for private parties.
author: Shan K.

description: Upon entering, I could faintly smell the familiar smell of ... pee.  My friend didn't, so who knows, maybe it was just me.  This is a great neighborhood bar, and if you live close by- and excellent place to stumble home from.  They have a great selection of beer on tap, from Hefeweisen to Stella to Amstel Light.  Also, a pool table in the back of the bar.  I liked that it wasn't too crowded here, and it's a great place for people watching too.  The bartender seemed really sweet and nice.  Still, to me, this place looks a lot cuter on the outside than the inside.
author: Sarah F.

description: I really like this place. It is of the most mellow spots in the neighborhood. Now that the Barleycorn is gone, go here to sit by the fire and unwind with some friends and cocktail.
author: Adrienne G.

description: This is a great neighborhood bar. No pretentiousness - no scene. Affordable drinks, great jukebox, fireplace, and pool table.
author: Stephanie I.

description:
finally made it here for more then just a drink...it was fun!  laid back crowd.  good people.  lots of guys.  and they have HOEGAARDEN!!  which know seals the deal for me.

more expensive then i thought it would be (in my mind it was gonna be cheap dollars)...but no more then most other bars.  

seems to be a good place to catch a game.  (which surprised me).
author: jessie h.

description: Great Nob Hill spot to grab a drink mid-week.  Seems to be a local fav and has really cool bartenders.
author: George M.

description: I went out there last week with a girl friend of mine and managed to shut the place down.  I like that there are plenty of nooks for people to sit and talk.  Their jukebox was decent and the drinks were OK for this part of town.  I'd go back if I were to return to Nob Hill... I rarely get over there.
author: Thadd L.

description: I've spent many, many hours here watching my boyfriend suck at pool and I don't hate the place. That should be enough to tell you that the ambiance is pretty cool, the crowd is pretty nice and the drinks are pretty good. Plus they let you order food to be delivered to the bar. What more could you ask for?
author: Cathy T.

description: I went to Zeki's for drinks with my boyfriend and his friend and girlfriend after dinner.  We walked in and immediately found a table.  The atmosphere was great, but you have to be in the mood for a dark and dive type place.  I will never forget my experience there b/c it was where I felt my first earthquake.  BUT unfortunately I didn't really feel much because I was laughing and having too good of a time that I wasn't paying attention.  I hope that we venture there again soon :)
author: Tara P.

description: This place is SO CLOSE to me, I can see myself coming here on the regular.  It's chill and nice, pool table and jukebox for entertainment....it accommodated our group of...what, 15?  20? no problem.  It just has a nice air about it I like.
author: Charlotte M.

description: Another place that I wanted to like since it's really close to where I live and there are holiday lights all over which makes it look so inviting from outside.  Alas, the crowd was a complete turn off.  I felt like I was at a frat party.  No thank you.
author: Helen C.

description: Not my kind of place.  The crowd was obnoxious, the service excruciatingly slow, and the location offers local, nob-hill type who either can't afford or won't pay, for a ride to the marina, a chance to sip some ersatz marina vapors.   I'm sure there is a crowd that fits in, and I'm happy they have a place to hang.
author: Daniel O.

description: Strong to very strong neighborhood bar.  Bonus points for ridiculously friendly staff and good beer selection.  Menos puntos for awful parking anywhere near the joint.
author: Matt S.

description: As far as neighborhood bars go, this one isn't mine, but I kind of wish it was. On a cold Sunday night it had perfectly few people, a fireplace going, and people chatting like they run into each other all the time. Great vibe, inexpensive booze, and the peaked roof with rafters gives it a nostalgic Alpine feel, like you're on vacation for all of a half hour.
author: kay v.

description: bad staff, long lines, mediocre drinks
author: Nick S.

description: Seriously, this is a professional drinkers bar which on most days is a great neighborhood bar. It's a good Friday night ramp up around 9:30-11 then head on to the next spot. Other nights, you go here to get faded and play Connect Four, not pontificate about how Nero defeated the Parthians. And yes, Maho is the name of a Turkish god.
author: Eric W.

description: Great hideaway bar...perfect for a post dinner date drink. Nice fireplace, strong cocktails (and cute bartenders if the date's going nowhere quickly). Pretty solid jukebox as well.
author: Mike P.

description: i love coming here on a tuesday night with my roommates. its a great place to meet old friends or just check up with your buddies. There is a cozy fireplace and a good juke box. The bartenders do a great job especially when its packed.
author: Jen S.

description:
yay local watering hole ... always a fun local nob hill crowd. 
chill and laid back to bring friends to watch the game or stop in on the way home from a night out and belly up...
author: Ashleigh G.

description: For all of you who were at the book club meeting here i am sure i am the last of us to post a review and i am sure it will be a carbon copy of what you had to said.  If this is the case I apologize a head of time.  I thought this place was great first off and for most.  The staff was very friendly and considerate.  After evryone left I sat and had beer with the bartender and talked sports and music for a hour or so.  The music they played was killer as well.  The only down fall was the price of the beers was a little high for being a neighborhodd haunt of a bar.
author: brian m.

description: Great place for a local gal to get a good, stiff drink with a buddy.
author: Virginia J.

description: Great bar with a friendly and lively atmosphere. I get a happy feeling everytime I go there, but that could just be the tequila shots.
author: Tom G.

description:
Great place for a drink.  Bartenders are friendly (i'm good friends with one of them from college) and attractive.  The drinks are stff.  And the owner Maho is kind enough to put up with my friends and I.

Even though I live across town, I highly recommend this place as a local bar.
author: Jason C.

description: this would be such a perfect neighborhood bar for me if only it were near my apt!!! as soon as i walked in i felt at home and knew i would love it. my girlfriends and i were able to sit at the bar, have a few drinks, enjoy the games and let loose for an all around good casual time. everyone was super friendly around us and behind the bar, the drinks were affordable and strong what more can you ask for :)
author: Barbara C.

description: Great bar and used to have a great jukebox but now it has the internet type.
author: Jake B.

description: The Platonic ideal of a neighborhood bar, dark, uncorporate, as comfortable as your favorite pair of socks.  Timeless dreamy rock, tonight a Pogues album straight through.  The bartender is a combination of big and strong, uninhibited boobs, peasant dress and no makeup, a hippie version of the Saint Pauli girl.  A couple affirming their relationship in front of the fireplace.  A man in a beanie chews his straw and teases the bartender, entertaining his friends.  At the pool table serious men, shoot straight and chalk their cue on every shot.  The electricity to the Christmas lights is a case study on how to start a fire, and there's basketball on the screen.  The wall is peppered with little framed 80-year-old photographs and there are stacks of neighborhood papers on the counter.  I do not see a single self-conscious person in here, nobody is preening or posing, not one here lives by compromise.
author: Gil S.

description: My favorite local neighborhood dive bar.  The service is always friendly and the owner off stops by to enjoy a drink with you.  Some nights it is not very crowded and makes a great place to catch up with a friend.  Other nights it is packed and little more lively.
author: Michael M.

description: It's a fun place to catch a Laker game with other Laker fans and watching the 2010 NBA finals game 7 (between the Lakers and Celtics) here was a lot of fun! Good group of people.
author: J J.

description: Totally a great neighborhood weekday bar.  I've been here more times than I can count - I watched Obama win here.  Great bar if you like low-key, good drinks, great company.
author: Melissa S.

description: wannabe neighborhood bar with a bunch of wannabe neighborhood "locals". still, it is a pretty cool bar with decent drink prices.
author: Dean E.

description: Super cozy neighborhood bar! They make you feel always welcomed!
author: al a.
